All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Adventure
Class representing an adventure in the application's business model.
AdventureAPIDAO
Class that implements the methods described in the AdventureDAO interface, and will be used as a way to physically separate the persistence layer from the rest of the application.
AdventureDAO
Interface that abstracts the persistence of adventures from uppers.
AdventureJsonDAO
Class that implements the methods described in the AdventureDAO interface, and will be used as a way to physically separate the persistence layer from the rest of the application.
AdventureManager
Class that focuses on logic related to adventures and connects the business layer to lower ones, specifically the persistence layer.
ApiHelper
Helper class with the responsibility of reading and posting Strings to an HTTPS API.
BossMonster
Class representing a boss monster in the application's business model.
Champion
Class representing a champion in the application's business model.
Character
Class representing a character in the application's business model.
CharacterAPIDAO
Class that implements the methods described in the CharacterDAO interface, and will be used as a way to physically separate the persistence layer from the rest of the application.
CharacterDAO
Interface that abstracts the persistence of characters from uppers.
CharacterJsonDAO
Class that implements the methods described in the CharacterDAO interface, and will be used as a way to physically separate the persistence layer from the rest of the application.
CharacterManager
Class that focuses on logic related to characters and connects the business layer to lower ones, specifically the persistence layer.
Cleric
Class representing a cleric in the application's business model.
ConsoleUIManager
Implementation of the ConsoleUIManager interface that provides interaction with the user.
DataMenuOptions
Options that can be used in the starting menu, including: DataMenuOptions.LOCAL_DATA DataMenuOptions.CLOUD_DATA
Encounter
Class representing an encounter in the application's business model.
EncounterMenuOptions
Options that can be used in the encounter menu, including: EncounterMenuOptions.ADD_MONSTER EncounterMenuOptions.REMOVE_MONSTER EncounterMenuOptions.CONTINUE
Main
The application's main class, just to hold the main method.
MainMenuOptions
Options that can be used in the menu, including: MainMenuOptions.CHARACTER_CREATION MainMenuOptions.LIST_CHARACTERS MainMenuOptions.CREATE_ADVENTURE MainMenuOptions.START_ADVENTURE
Monster
Class representing a monster in the application's business model.
MonsterAPIDAO
Class that implements the methods described in the MonsterDAO interface, and will be used as a way to physically separate the persistence layer from the rest of the application.
MonsterDAO
Interface that abstracts the persistence of monsters from uppers.
MonsterFileNotFoundException
Custom exception to raise when something goes wrong when trying to access the monster's json file.
MonsterJsonDAO
Class that implements the methods described in the MonsterDAO interface, and will be used as a way to physically separate the persistence layer from the rest of the application.
MonsterManager
Class that focuses on logic related to monsters and connects the business layer to lower ones, specifically the persistence layer.
Paladin
Class representing a paladin in the application's business model.
PersistenceException
Custom exception to raise when something goes wrong in the persistence layer.
UIController
Controller for the user interface, the main entry point for the application's logic, which will talk to the rest of the presentation layer as well as to the business layer.
UIManager
Interface that abstracts the UI implementation by providing certain functions to use when interaction with the user is needed.
Warrior
Class representing a warrior in the application's business model.
Wizard
Class representing a wizard in the application's business model.
